intro: Rubus schmidelyanus microgene viridiramus, commonly known as the green-veined raspberry, is a rare species of bramble belonging to the Rosaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant produces small, tart red fruits that are typically harvested in late summer. Its leaves are trifoliate, with serrated edges and a distinctive greenish hue on the veins. This species is native to specific regions of Europe and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
